member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.PaymentMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method of payment.
member.remarks: PayPal supports several different payment methods. The parameter method is used to define the payment method to be selected for the current order. If method is not entered or is left empty, the assumption is made that it is an Express Checkout purchase (same as express.checkout).

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.IsTest
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is test mode.
member.value: true if in test mode; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.Currency
member.summary: Gets or sets the currency.
member.remarks: A three-character currency code for one of the currencies mentioned below. Default: USD. (AUD, CAD, CHF, CZK, DKK, EUR, GBP, HKD, HUF, JPY, NOK, NZD, PLN, SEK, SGD, USD)

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.OrderTotal
member.summary: Gets or sets the order total.
member.remarks: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.ItemTotalWithoutTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the item total without tax.
member.remarks: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.ItemTax
member.summary: Gets or sets the item tax.
member.remarks: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.ShippingCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the shipping cost.
member.remarks: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.HandlingCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the handling cost.
member.remarks: Must not exceed $10,000 USD in any currency. No currency symbol. Must have two decimal places, decimal separator must be a period (.), and the optional thousands separator must be a comma (,).

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.CartItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the cart items.

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.Email
member.summary: Gets or sets the customer email.
member.value: Email address of the customer. PayPal uses this value to pre-fill the PayPal membership sign-up portion of the PayPal login page. Character length and limit: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.OrderId
member.summary: Gets or sets the order id.
member.remarks: The unique order id. PayPal returns this value to you on DoExpressCheckoutPayment response. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters

member.name: P:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.OrderParams.CountryCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the country code of the customer.
member.value: Determines the locale of pages displayed by PayPal during Express Checkout. Character length and limitations: Any two-character country code. The following two-character country codes are supported by PayPal: (AT, AU, BE, CA, CH, CN, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, NL, PL, US) Any other value will default to US.

member.name: T:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus
member.summary: Paypal transaction status

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.None
member.summary: No status.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.CanceledReversal
member.summary: A reversal has been canceled; for example, when you win a dispute and the funds for the reversal have been returned to you.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Completed
member.summary: The payment has been completed, and the funds have been added successfully to your account balance.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Denied
member.summary: You denied the payment. This happens only if the payment was previously pending because of possible reasons described for the PendingReason element.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Expired
member.summary: The authorization period for this payment has been reached.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Failed
member.summary: The payment has failed. This happens only if the payment was made from your customer’s bank account.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.InProgress
member.summary: The transaction has not terminated, e.g. an authorization may be awaiting completion.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.PartiallyRefunded
member.summary: The payment has been partially refunded.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Pending
member.summary: The payment is pending. See the PendingReason field for more information.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Refunded
member.summary: You refunded the payment.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Reversed
member.summary: A payment was reversed due to a chargeback or other type of reversal. The funds have been removed from your account balance and returned to the buyer. The reason for the reversal is specified in the ReasonCode element.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Processed
member.summary: A payment has been accepted.

member.name: F:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.TransactionStatus.Voided
member.summary: An authorization for this transaction has been voided.

member.name: M:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.PayPalProvider.OnProviderCallback(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Boolean,Litium.Foundation.Security.SecurityToken)
member.summary: Method to execute when the Payment provider redirects back into Litium studio after a call to it.
member.param: if the Payment provider result redirected to success, this is true, else false.
member.remarks:
After calling any of the methods on the payment providers external API, usually over a web service, over a HTTP post, remote procedure call or a similar method, the payment provider will redirect the execution control back into Litium Studio.
The execution control is given back by the provider by redirecting back to a Litium Studio page or a entry port such as a webhandler, in most cases.
Usually, this redirect location is given to the payment provider when calling the method.
After getting the execution control back, this method should be called, irrespective of the result of the execution.
In the implementation of this method, any post call back scenarios specific to payment provider should be handled.

member.name: M:Litium.Studio.Plugins.ECommerce.PaymentProviders.PayPal.PayPalProvider.SyncPaymentStatusWithProvider(Litium.Foundation.Security.SecurityToken)
member.summary: Syncs the payment status with provider.
member.remarks:
On occations where communication line failures or other errors occur during communication with payment provider, the payment status in Litium Studio may remain behind the internal status of the transaction in payment provider.
For example, suppose a ExecutePayment is called, which will put the payment status to InitiatedDirectPayment, but lets say the control does not return at all. The Payment status may remain at InitiatedDirectPayment when viewed from Litium Studio. But at the payment providers end, this status can be Failed, Reserved, Paid, etc.
This method should try to see whether a transaction exists in the target payment provider system, and if it exists find out its status and adjust the Payment status accordingly.

member.returns: True if successful, false otherwise.
